FuncDef:
The channel-set command bundles timeslots of a CE1 interface into a channel-set.
The undo channel-set command unbundles the timeslots of a CE1 interface from a channel-set.
By default, no timeslots of a CE1 interface are bundled into a channel-set.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of a channel-set that is formed by bundling timeslots of a CE1 interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 30.

Specifies the number or range of the timeslots to be bundled.
You can specify either a single timeslot or a range of timeslots. A comma (,) is used to separate timeslots, and a hyphen (-) is used to specify a timeslot range.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 31.

Specifies timeslot 0 to be bundled into a channel-set.The channel-set <set-number> timeslot-list <slotbitmask> ts0 command bundles timeslot 0 and the timeslots specified by <slotbitmask> into a channel-set.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A CE1 interface works in either of the following mode:
Channelized mode: A CE1 interface is divided into 32 timeslots physically. Timeslots 1 to 31 can be bundled into several channel-sets. Each channel-set functions as an interface whose logical features are the same as a synchronous serial interface. The interface serial command allows you to enter the view of the interface that is formed by bundling timeslots.Clear channel mode: A CE1 interface is not divided into timeslots and does not support the channel-set command. Instead, it is used as a 2.048 Mbit/s serial interface.

Prerequisites
A CE1 interface has been configured to work in channelized mode using the using ce1 command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
